Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the provision of counsel at fair hearings following an indicated report during an ACS investigation
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee

Items.MatterName: Reporting demographic information for emergency removals by the administration for children’s services.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to information regarding demographic information of parents and children at each step in the child welfare system and a plan to address racial and income disparities

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the administration for children’s services to provide information to parents or caretakers about their right to request a fair hearing to appeal an indicated report
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Requiring ACS to provide information to parents or caretakers about their right to request a fair hearing to appeal an indicated report.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring child protective specialists to orally disseminate information to parents or caretakers about their rights during initial contact at the start of an ACS investigation

Items.MatterName: Requiring child protective specialists to orally disseminate information to parents or caretakers about their rights during initial contact at the start of an ACS investigation.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature and the New York State Office of Children and Family Services to develop a parents’ bill of rights to be distributed at initial home visits in child protective investigations and made available online.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Develop a parents’ bill of rights to be distributed at initial home visits in child protective investigations and made available online.

Items.Title: Resolution urging New York State to reduce the length of time caretakers, parents or legal guardians remain on the Statewide Central Registry list.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Reduce the length of time caretakers, parents or legal guardians remain on the Statewide Central Registry list.
